recommendations.title: Right‑size EC2 Instances with Reserved/Spot Pricing
recommendations.description: Switch on‑demand instances to a mix of Reserved Instances and Spot Instances to reduce hourly rates by ~50%.
steps: Configure Spot Instance requests with fallback to On‑Demand.
Monitor cost savings and adjust bids.

recommendations.title: Move RDS to Aurora Serverless or Free Tier
recommendations.description: Migrate to Aurora Serverless or use the free tier if workload fits, eliminating the small RDS cost.
steps: Plan migration and perform test cutover.

recommendations.title: Implement S3 Lifecycle Policies
recommendations.description: Configure lifecycle rules to transition older objects to Glacier or delete them, reducing storage costs by ~10%.
steps: Apply lifecycle policy and monitor cost changes.

recommendations.title: Replace Lambda with Azure Functions Free Tier
recommendations.description: Port lightweight Lambda functions to Azure Functions, leveraging the generous free tier to cut invocation costs.
steps: Package Lambda code into Azure Functions.
Switch traffic gradually and monitor performance.

recommendations.title: Switch CloudFront to Azure CDN Free Tier
recommendations.description: Use Azure CDN with its free tier for low‑traffic content delivery, reducing distribution costs.
steps: Create Azure CDN endpoint and configure origins.
Update DNS/CNAME records to point to Azure CDN.
Validate cache hit ratio and performance.

recommendations.title: Move API Gateway to Azure API Management Free Tier
recommendations.description: Replace AWS API Gateway with Azure API Management free tier, eliminating gateway costs for 10k calls.

recommendations.title: Use Azure Monitor for Log Collection
recommendations.description: Send logs to Azure Monitor, which offers a free tier for basic log ingestion, eliminating CloudWatch Logs cost.
steps: Install Azure Monitor agent on instances.

recommendations.title: Replace SQS with Azure Service Bus Free Tier
recommendations.description: Migrate message queueing to Azure Service Bus, utilizing its free tier for 100,000 messages per month.
